sage.input

Class ComponentStateInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.input.ComponentStateInfo

  • public class ComponentStateInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    ComponentStateInfo stores state information for a specific component (key, button, or axis). Stored information includes the last Event associated with the component, the manner in which any IAction associated with the component is invoked, and whether or not the component is currently pressed. Note that for an Axis component the manner of invocation is not used (IActions associated with Axis components are invoked every time the Axis changes) and the notion of "pressed" does not apply to an Axis component.
    Author:
    John Clevenger; based on a development version by Russell Bolles

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComponentStateInfo

        public ComponentStateInfo(boolean pressed,
                          IInputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE actionType)
        Constructs a new ComponentStateInfo object containing the specified component state values. The Event member holding the last Event associated with the component is initialized to null.
        Parameters:
        pressed - - whether or not the new ComponentState indicates "pressed" or not
        actionType - - the way in which an action associated with the component is invoked (that, is WHEN the action gets invoked)

    • Method Detail

      • getEvent

        public net.java.games.input.Event getEvent()
        Returns the Event most recently associated with the component described by this ComponentStateInfo object. The Event is initialized to null prior to the occurrence of any events from the component.
        Returns:
        the most recent Event associated with the component

      • isPressed

        public boolean isPressed()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the component described by this object is in the "pressed" state. Note that this is not relevant for Axis components -- only for Buttons and Keys.
        Returns:
        whether or not the component is "pressed"

      • getActionType

        public IInputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE getActionType()
        Returns the IInputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE currently associated with the component whose state is described by this object.
        Returns:
        the component's IInputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE

      • markAsPressed

        public void markAsPressed()
        Marks this ComponentStateInfo object as "pressed".

      • markAsReleased

        public void markAsReleased()
        Marks this ComponentStateInfo object as "not pressed".

      • updateEvent

        public void updateEvent(net.java.games.input.Event evt)
        Attaches the specified event to the object, indicating that the specified event was the last event on the corresponding component. Marks the event as 'new'.

      • isNewEvent

        public boolean isNewEvent()
        Returns whether the event attached to this object is "new". Events are marked "new" when first attached to this object; they remain "new" until a client marks them otherwise.

      • markEventAsNew

        public void markEventAsNew(boolean isNew)
        Sets the state of the event attached to this object to "new" or "not new". Events are marked "new" when first attached to this object; they remain "new" until a client invokes this method with a parameter value of false.
